text:
Kenneth Eugene Behring (June 13, 1928 – June 25, 2019) was an American real estate developer, philanthropist and businessman. He was the former owner of the National Football League's Seattle Seahawks. He was born in Freeport, Illinois.
In 1996 and 1999, Behring was accused of sexual harassment by multiple women. He was also criticized of his trophy huntings and killed many endangered species.
Behring died on June 25, 2019 in Martinez, California at the age of 91.
